Zhao clan's forebears, together with Qin shared ancestor. Reached Zhong Yan, was Emperor Da Wu's charioteer. His later generations Feilian had sons two, and named his one son said Elai, served Zhou, was by Zhou killed, his descendants became Qin. Elai's younger brother named Jisheng, his descendants became Zhao.

Jisheng begat Mengzeng. Mengzeng favored by Zhou Cheng Wang, this was Zhaigaolang. Gaolang begat Hengfu, Hengfu begat Zaofu. Zaofu favored by Zhou Mu Wang. Zaofu took Ji's chariot team, together with Taolin's stolen Lilu, Hualiu, Lver, presented them to Mu Wang. Mu Wang made Zaofu drive, west toured, saw Xi Wang Mu, enjoyed it forgot return. While Xu Yan Wang rebelled, Mu Wang daily galloped thousand li horses, attacked Xu Yan Wang, greatly defeated him. Then granted Zaofu Zhao city, from this became Zhao clan.

From Zaofu below six generations to Yanfu, called Gongzhong, Zhou Xuan Wang time attacked Rong, was charioteer. When Qianmu battle, Yanfu rescued Xuan Wang. Yanfu begat Shudai. Shudai's time, Zhou You Wang without way, left Zhou went to Jin, served Jin Wen Hou, began building Zhao clan in Jin state.

From Shudai below, Zhao lineage increasingly flourished, five generations then reached Zhao Shu.

Zhao Shu, Jin Xian Gong's sixteenth year attacked Huo, Wei, Geng, and Zhao Shu was general attacked Huo. Huo Gong Qiu fled to Qi. Jin great drought, divined it, said 'Huo Taishan is causing the trouble.' Made Zhao Shu summon Huo lord from Qi, restored him, to offer Huo Taishan's sacrifices, Jin again prosperous. Jin Xian Gong granted Zhao Shu Geng.

Shu begat Gong Meng, was in Lu Min Gong's first year. Gong Meng begat Zhao Shuai, styled Ziyv.

Zhao Shuai divined serving Jin Xian Gong and various princes, none auspicious. Divined serving Prince Chong'er, auspicious, then served Chong'er. Chong'er because of Li Ji's disorder fled to Di, Zhao Shuai followed. Di attacked Xia Jiuru, obtained two women, Di with their younger daughter married Chong'er, elder daughter married Zhao Shuai and gave birth to Dun. Initially, when Chong'er was in Jin, Zhao Shuai's wife also gave birth to Zhao Tong, Zhao Kuo, Zhao Yingqi. Zhao Shuai followed Chong'er went into exile, altogether nineteen years, got to return to country. Chong'er became Jin Wen Gong, Zhao Shuai became Yuan grand master, resided in Yuan, took charge of state affairs. Wen Gong's return to country and hegemony, mostly Zhao Shuai's strategies, speech in Jin matters middle.

Zhao Shuai having returned to Jin, Jin's wife strongly demanded to welcome Di wife, and made her son Dun the proper heir, Jin wife's three sons all served below him. Jin Xiang Gong's sixth year, and Zhao Shuai died, posthumous name Cheng Ji.

è¶™ç›¾ä»£æˆå­£ä»»åœ‹æ”¿äºŒå¹´è€Œæ™‰è¥„å…¬å’ï¼Œå¤ªå­å¤·çš‹å¹´å°‘ã€‚ ç›¾ç‚ºåœ‹å¤šé›£ï¼Œæ¬²ç«‹è¥„å…¬å¼Ÿé›ã€‚ é›æ™‚åœ¨ç§¦ï¼Œä½¿ä½¿è¿ä¹‹ã€‚ å¤ªå­æ¯æ—¥å¤œå•¼æ³£ï¼Œé “é¦–è¬‚è¶™ç›¾æ›°ï¼šã€Œå…ˆå›ä½•ç½ªï¼Œé‡‹å…¶é©å­è€Œæ›´æ±‚å›ï¼Ÿã€ è¶™ç›¾æ‚£ä¹‹ï¼Œæå…¶å®—èˆ‡å¤§å¤«è¥²èª…ä¹‹ï¼Œä¹ƒé‚ç«‹å¤ªå­ï¼Œæ˜¯ç‚ºéˆå…¬ï¼Œç™¼å…µè·æ‰€è¿è¥„å…¬å¼Ÿæ–¼ç§¦è€…ã€‚ éˆå…¬æ—¢ç«‹ï¼Œè¶™ç›¾ç›Šå°ˆåœ‹æ”¿ã€‚
Zhao Dun replaced Cheng Ji took charge of state affairs two years and Jin Xiang Gong died, Crown Prince Yi Gao young. Dun for country's many difficulties, wished to establish Xiang Gong's younger brother Yong. Yong at that time in Qin, sent envoy welcomed him. Crown Prince's mother day and night wept and wailed, kowtowed said to Zhao Dun: 'Former lord what crime, abandon his proper son and seek another lord?' Zhao Dun worried about it, feared his clan and grand masters would suddenly execute him, then established the crown prince, this was Ling Gong, sent troops to block those welcoming Xiang Gong's younger brother from Qin. Ling Gong having been established, Zhao Dun increasingly monopolized state affairs.
10
éˆå…¬ç«‹åå››å¹´ï¼Œç›Šé©•ã€‚ è¶™ç›¾é©Ÿè««ï¼Œéˆå…¬å¼—è½ã€‚ åŠé£Ÿç†Šè¹¯ï¼Œèƒ¹ä¸ç†Ÿï¼Œæ®ºå®°äººï¼ŒæŒå…¶å°¸å‡ºï¼Œè¶™ç›¾è¦‹ä¹‹ã€‚ éˆå…¬ç”±æ­¤æ‡¼ï¼Œæ¬²æ®ºç›¾ã€‚ ç›¾ç´ ä»æ„›äººï¼Œå˜—æ‰€é£Ÿæ¡‘ä¸‹é¤“äººåææ•‘ç›¾ï¼Œç›¾ä»¥å¾—äº¡ã€‚ æœªå‡ºå¢ƒï¼Œè€Œè¶™ç©¿å¼’éˆå…¬è€Œç«‹è¥„å…¬å¼Ÿé»‘è‡€ï¼Œæ˜¯ç‚ºæˆå…¬ã€‚ è¶™ç›¾å¾©åï¼Œä»»åœ‹æ”¿ã€‚ å›å­è­ç›¾ã€Œç‚ºæ­£å¿ï¼Œäº¡ä¸å‡ºå¢ƒï¼Œåä¸è¨è³Šã€ï¼Œæ•…å¤ªå²æ›¸æ›°ã€Œè¶™ç›¾å¼’å…¶å›ã€ã€‚ æ™‰æ™¯å…¬æ™‚è€Œè¶™ç›¾å’ï¼Œè¬šç‚ºå®£å­Ÿï¼Œå­æœ”å—£ã€‚
Ling Gong established fourteen years, increasingly arrogant. Zhao Dun repeatedly admonished, Ling Gong did not listen. When eating bear's paw, stew not cooked, killed the butcher, carried his corpse out, Zhao Dun saw it. Ling Gong from this feared, wished to kill Dun. Dun usually benevolent loved people, once the hungry person under mulberry tree he fed returned protected saved Dun, Dun thereby got to escape. Not yet out of borders, and Zhao Chuan assassinated Ling Gong and established Xiang Gong's younger brother Heitun, this was Cheng Gong. Zhao Dun again returned, took charge of state affairs. Gentleman criticized Dun 'as chief minister, exile not out of borders, return not punish traitor', therefore grand scribe wrote said 'Zhao Dun assassinated his lord'. Jin Jing Gong time and Zhao Dun died, posthumous name Xuan Meng, son Shuo succeeded.

Zhao Shuo, Jin Jing Gong's third year, Shuo was Jin's lower army general saved Zheng, with Chu Zhuang Wang battled on Yellow River. Shuo married Jin Cheng Gong's elder sister as wife.

æ™‰æ™¯å…¬ä¹‹ä¸‰å¹´ï¼Œå¤§å¤«å± å²¸è³ˆæ¬²èª…è¶™æ°ã€‚ åˆï¼Œè¶™ç›¾åœ¨æ™‚ï¼Œå¤¢è¦‹å”å¸¶æŒè¦è€Œå“­ï¼Œç”šæ‚²ï¼› å·²è€Œç¬‘ï¼Œæ‹Šæ‰‹ä¸”æ­Œã€‚ ç›¾åœä¹‹ï¼Œå…†çµ•è€Œå¾Œå¥½ã€‚ è¶™å²æ´å ä¹‹ï¼Œæ›°ï¼šã€Œæ­¤å¤¢ç”šæƒ¡ï¼Œéå›ä¹‹èº«ï¼Œä¹ƒå›ä¹‹å­ï¼Œç„¶äº¦å›ä¹‹å’ã€‚ è‡³å­«ï¼Œè¶™å°‡ä¸–ç›Šè¡°ã€‚ã€ å± å²¸è³ˆè€…ï¼Œå§‹æœ‰å¯µæ–¼éˆå…¬ï¼ŒåŠè‡³æ–¼æ™¯å…¬è€Œè³ˆç‚ºå¸å¯‡ï¼Œå°‡ä½œé›£ï¼Œä¹ƒæ²»éˆå…¬ä¹‹è³Šä»¥è‡´è¶™ç›¾ï¼Œéå‘Šè«¸å°‡æ›°ï¼šã€Œç›¾é›–ä¸çŸ¥ï¼ŒçŒ¶ç‚ºè³Šé¦–ã€‚ ä»¥è‡£å¼’å›ï¼Œå­å­«åœ¨æœï¼Œä½•ä»¥æ‡²ç½ªï¼Ÿ è«‹èª…ä¹‹ã€‚ã€ éŸ“å¥æ›°ï¼šã€Œéˆå…¬é‡è³Šï¼Œè¶™ç›¾åœ¨å¤–ï¼Œå¾å…ˆå›ä»¥ç‚ºç„¡ç½ªï¼Œæ•…ä¸èª…ã€‚ ä»Šè«¸å›å°‡èª…å…¶å¾Œï¼Œæ˜¯éå…ˆå›ä¹‹æ„è€Œä»Šå¦„èª…ã€‚ å¦„èª…è¬‚ä¹‹äº‚ã€‚ è‡£æœ‰å¤§äº‹è€Œå›ä¸èï¼Œæ˜¯ç„¡å›ä¹Ÿã€‚ã€ å± å²¸è³ˆä¸è½ã€‚ éŸ“å¥å‘Šè¶™æœ”è¶£äº¡ã€‚ æœ”ä¸è‚¯ï¼Œæ›°ï¼šã€Œå­å¿…ä¸çµ•è¶™ç¥€ï¼Œæœ”æ­»ä¸æ¨ã€‚ã€ éŸ“å¥è¨±è«¾ï¼Œç¨±ç–¾ä¸å‡ºã€‚ è³ˆä¸è«‹è€Œæ“…èˆ‡è«¸å°‡æ”»è¶™æ°æ–¼ä¸‹å®®ï¼Œæ®ºè¶™æœ”ã€è¶™åŒã€è¶™æ‹¬ã€è¶™å¬°é½Šï¼Œçš†æ»…å…¶æ—ã€‚
Jin Jing Gong's third year, grand master Tu An Jia wished to execute Zhao clan. Initially, when Zhao Dun was alive, dreamed saw Shudai held waist and cried, very sad. Then laughed, clapped hands and sang. Dun divined it, omen broken then afterwards good. Zhao scribe Yuan interpreted it, said: 'This dream very bad, not lord's body, rather lord's son, yet also lord's fault. Reach grandson, Zhao will generation increasingly decline.' Tu An Jia, initially had favor with Ling Gong, and reached Jing Gong and Jia was judicial minister, about to make disturbance, then investigated Ling Gong's assassin to implicate Zhao Dun, widely told various generals said: 'Dun though did not know, still was traitor head. With minister assassinated lord, descendants in court, how to punish crime? Request execute them.' Han Que said: 'Ling Gong encountered traitor, Zhao Dun outside, my former lord considered no crime, therefore did not execute. Now various lords about to execute his descendants, this not former lord's intention and now recklessly execute. Reckless execution called disorder. Minister has great matter and lord not hear, this is without lord also.' Tu An Jia did not listen. Han Que told Zhao Shuo hasten flee. Shuo not willing, said: 'You must not cut off Zhao sacrifices, Shuo die without regret.' Han Que promised, claimed illness did not go out. Jia not request and arbitrarily with various generals attacked Zhao clan at lower palace, killed Zhao Shuo, Zhao Tong, Zhao Kuo, Zhao Yingqi, all extinguished their clans.

Zhao Shuo's wife Cheng Gong's elder sister, had posthumous child, fled ducal palace hid. Zhao Shuo's guest called Gongsun Chujiu, Chujiu said to Shuo's friend Cheng Ying: 'Why not die?' Cheng Ying said: 'Shuo's wife has posthumous child, if fortunately male, I will support him; If female also, I slowly die only.' Resided not long, and Shuo's wife gave birth, bore male. Tu An Jia heard it, searched in palace. Lady placed child rebuked crevice priest said: 'Zhao lineage extinguished huh, if cry; If not extinguished, if no sound.' When searched, child ultimately no sound. Already escaped, Cheng Ying said to Gongsun Chujiu: 'Now one search not obtained, later must moreover again search it, what to do?' Gongsun Chujiu said: 'Establish orphan with die which difficult?' Cheng Ying said: 'Die easy, establish orphan difficult only.' Gongsun Chujiu said: 'Zhao clan former lord treated you generously, you strong do its difficult ones, I do its easy ones, request first die.' Then two people planned took other person's infant carried it, clothed with patterned quilt, hid mountain middle. Cheng Ying went out, falsely said to various generals: 'Ying unworthy, cannot establish Zhao orphan. Who can give me thousand gold, I tell Zhao clan orphan location.' Various generals all happy, promised it, sent troops followed Cheng Ying attacked Gongsun Chujiu. Chujiu falsely said: 'Small man indeed Cheng Ying! Formerly lower palace's difficulty could not die, with me planned hid Zhao clan orphan child, now again sell me. Even if cannot establish, yet endure sell it huh!' Embraced child called said: 'Heaven huh heaven huh! Zhao clan orphan child what crime? Request let live it, alone kill Chujiu can also.' Various generals not permitted, then killed Chujiu and orphan. Various generals considered Zhao clan orphan truly already dead, all happy. Yet Zhao clan true orphan then instead present, Cheng Ying finally with him together hid mountain middle.

Jian Zi thereupon knew Wu Xu indeed worthy, then abolished crown prince Bo Lu, and with Wu Xu as crown prince.

Later two years, Jin Ding Gong's fourteenth year, Fan, Zhong Xing made rebellion. Next year spring, Jian Zi told Han Dan grand master Wu said: 'Return me Wei soldiers five hundred households, I will place them Jin Yang.' Wu promised, returned and his father elder brothers not listen, doubled words. Zhao Yang captured Wu, imprisoned him Jin Yang. Then told Han Dan people said: 'I privately have executed Wu also, various lords wish who establish?' Then killed Wu. Zhao Ji, She Bin with Han Dan rebelled. Jin lord sent Ji Qin surround Han Dan. Xun Yin, Fan Ji She with Wu friendly, not willing assist Qin and planned make rebellion, Dong An Yu knew it. Tenth month, Fan, Zhong Xing clan attacked Zhao Yang, Yang fled Jin Yang, Jin people surrounded him. Fan Ji She, Xun Yin enemy Wei Xiang etc. planned expel Xun Yin, with Liang Ying Fu replace him; Expelled Ji She, with Fan Gao Xi replace him. Xun Li spoke to Jin Marquis said: 'Lord commands ministers, start rebellion ones die. Now three ministers started rebellion but alone expel Yang, use punishment not equal, please all expel them.' Eleventh month, Xun Li, Han Bu Ning, Wei Duo received duke command to attack Fan, Zhong Xing clan, not conquer. Fan, Zhong Xing clan counter attacked duke, duke struck them, Fan, Zhong Xing defeated fled. Ding Wei, two sons fled Zhao Ge. Han, Wei with Zhao clan as request. Twelfth month Xin Wei, Zhao Yang entered Jiang, allied at duke palace. Its next year, Zhi Bo Wen Zi told Zhao Yang said: 'Fan, Zhong Xing though truly made rebellion, An Yu revealed it, this is An Yu with planned also. Jin state has law, start rebellion ones die. Indeed two sons already submitted to punishment but An Yu alone remains.' Zhao Yang worried it. An Yu said: 'Minister dies, Zhao clan settles, Jin state pacifies, my death late already.' Then committed suicide. Zhao clan with told Zhi Bo, then Zhao clan pacified.

Nineteenth year spring first month, great court Xin Gong. Summoned Fei Yi and discussed world, five days and finished. Wang north raided Zhong Shan territory, reached Fang Zi, then Dai, north to endless, west to river, ascended Huang Hua above. Summoned Lou Huan discussed said: 'My former wang followed world's changes, extended southern border lands, connected to Zhang, Fu dangers, established long wall, also took Lin, Guo Lang, defeated Lin people at Ren, but merit not completed. Now Zhong Shan in my heart, north has Yan, east has Hu, west has Lin Hu, Lou Fan, Qin, Han borders, but no strong troops rescue, this perishes state altars, how huh?' Indeed has surpassing world reputation, must has leaving custom burden. I wish barbarian clothing.' Lou Huan said: 'Good.' Various ministers all not wished.

Thereupon Fei Yi served, wang said: 'Jian, Xiang lord achievements, planned Hu, Di benefits. Being minister ones, favor has filial piety younger brother elder younger obedient clear principles, general has benefit people benefit lord achievements, these two minister duty also. Now I wish continue Xiang lord traces, open to Hu, Di regions, but end generation not see also. Makes enemies weak, uses strength little but merit many, can not exhaust commoners labor, and continues past ancient merits. Indeed has surpassing world merit ones, bear leaving custom burden; Has unique wisdom considerations ones, bears stubborn people resentment. Now I will barbarian clothing horse archery teach commoners, but world must criticize me, how huh?' Fei Yi said: 'Minister heard doubtful matters no merit, doubtful actions no reputation. Wang already decided bear leaving custom considerations, nearly no regard world criticisms also. Indeed discusses utmost virtue ones not harmonize with custom, completes great merit ones not plans with masses. Formerly Shun danced You Miao, Yu bare naked state, not to nurture desires and please will also, strives to discuss virtue and summarize merit also. Foolish ones dark complete matters, wise ones see unformed, then wang what doubt huh.' Wang said: 'I not doubt barbarian clothing also, I fear world laugh me also. Mad husband joy, wise ones grieve huh; Foolish ones what laugh, worthy ones examine huh. World has follow me ones, barbarian clothing merit not yet knowable also. Although drive world to laugh me, barbarian land Zhong Shan I must have it.' Thereupon then barbarian clothed also.

Sent Wang Xi gong zi Cheng said: 'I barbarian clothed, will use to court also, also wish uncle wear it. Family obeys parents and state obeys lord, ancient present common practice also. Son not oppose parents, minister not defy lord, brothers common righteousness also. Now I create teaching change clothing but uncle not wear, I fear world criticize it also. Governing state has constants, benefiting people is foundation; Following governance has classics, command actions superior. Bright virtue first discussed among lowly, but governing affairs first trustworthiness among noble. Now barbarian clothing intention, not to nurture desires and please will also; Matters have stopping place and merit has coming out, matters succeed established, then good also. Now I fear uncle oppose follow governance classics, to help uncle discussions. Moreover I heard it, matters benefit state ones actions no crooked, rely on noble relatives ones reputation not burdened, hence wish admire duke uncle righteousness, to complete barbarian clothing merit. Make Xi visit uncle, request wear it.' Gong Zi Cheng twice bowed knocked head said: 'Minister indeed heard wang barbarian clothing also. Minister not talented, bed illness, unable hasten run to moreover advance also. Wang commands it, minister dares respond, thus exhausts his foolish loyalty. Said: Minister heard China ones, indeed clever understanding obedient wisdom place reside also, myriad things wealth use place gather also, worthy sages place teach also, benevolence righteousness place apply also, poems books rites music place use also, different clever skills place test also, distant places place observe hasten also, barbarian yi place righteousness act also. Now wang abandons this and follows distant places clothing, changes ancient teachings, alters ancient people ways, opposes people hearts, and frustrates scholars, separates China, hence minister wishes wang plan it also.' Messenger with report. Wang said: 'I indeed heard uncle illness also, I will personally go invite him.'

Wang then went to Gong Zi Cheng home, thus personally invited him, said: 'Indeed clothing ones, what convenient use also; Rites ones, what convenient matters also. Sage people observe regions and follow suitable, rely on matters and establish rites, what benefit their people and enrich their state also. Indeed cut hair tattoo body, tattoo arms left lapel, Ou Yue people also. Black teeth carved forehead, reversed crown grain sash, great Wu state also. Hence rites clothing not same, their convenience one also. Regions different and use changes, matters different and rites alter. This why sage people if can benefit their state, not unify their use; If can convenient their matters, not same their rites. Ru scholars one teacher but customs different, China same rites but teachings separate, moreover about mountain valley convenience huh? Hence leave take changes, wise ones cannot unify; Far near clothing, worthy sages cannot same. Remote regions many different, crooked learning many arguments. Not know but not doubt, different from self but not criticize ones, public huh and masses seek complete good also. Now uncle what speak custom also, I what speak what govern custom also. My state east has river, Bo Luo waters, with Qi, Zhong Shan same it, no boat oar use. From Chang Shan to Dai, Shang Dang, east has Yan, Dong Hu borders, and west has Lou Fan, Qin, Han borders, now no horse archery preparations. Hence I no boat oar use, between waters dwell people, will what guard river, Bo Luo waters; Change clothing horse archery, to prepare Yan, three Hu, Qin, Han borders. Moreover formerly Jian lord not block Jin Yang and reach Shang Dang, but Xiang lord annexed Rong Dai to expel various Hu, this foolish wise what clear also. Former time Zhong Shan relied Qi strong troops, invaded ravaged my land, tied bound my people, led water surrounded Xiang, slight state altars spirits, then Xiang nearly not guarded also. Former wang hated it, but resentment not yet repaid also. Now horse archery preparations, near can convenient Shang Dang terrain, but far can repay Zhong Shan resentment. But uncle follows China custom to oppose Jian, Xiang intentions, hates change clothing name to forget Xiang matter shame, not I what hope also.' Gong Zi Cheng twice bowed knocked head said: 'Minister foolish, not reach wang righteousness, dare speak world custom heard, minister crime also. Now wang will continue Jian, Xiang intentions to follow former wang will, minister dare not listen command huh!' Twice bowed knocked head. Then granted barbarian clothing. Next day, wore and attended court. Thereupon began issue barbarian clothing command also.

Zhao Wen, Zhao Zao, Zhou Shan, Zhao Jun all advised stop wang not barbarian clothing, like old law convenient. The king said: 'Former kings had different customs, what ancient laws exist?' Emperors and kings do not imitate each other, what rituals should be followed? Fuxi and Shennong taught without punishing, Yellow Emperor, Yao, and Shun punished without anger. When it came to the Three Kings, they made laws according to the times, created rituals according to circumstances. Laws, measures, decrees, and commands each followed what was appropriate, clothing and implements each suited their use. Therefore, ritual does not necessarily follow one path, and what benefits the state does not necessarily come from antiquity. The rise of sages does not imitate predecessors to become kings, the decline of Xia and Yin did not change rituals to perish. Thus, returning to antiquity cannot be criticized, but following ritual is not sufficient praise. Moreover, those who wear strange clothing have licentious ambitions, but this means that Zou and Lu have no exceptional conduct; Customs that are eccentric make the people fickle, but this means that Wu and Yue have no outstanding scholars. Moreover, the sages called benefiting the body 'clothing', and what facilitates affairs 'ritual'. Indeed, the regulations for advancing and retreating, the systems for clothing, these are to regulate the common people, not to judge the worthy. Therefore, regulate the people to flow with customs, the worthy accompany changes. Therefore the proverb says: 'One who drives a horse by the book does not understand the horse's temperament, one who applies ancient systems to today does not comprehend changes in affairs.' The merit of following the law is not sufficient to stand above the world; Studying the laws of antiquity is not sufficient to govern the present. You are not equal to it.' Thus he adopted barbarian clothing and recruited cavalry archers.

äºŒåå¹´ï¼Œç‹ç•¥ä¸­å±±åœ°ï¼Œè‡³å¯§è‘­ï¼› è¥¿ç•¥èƒ¡åœ°ï¼Œè‡³æ¦†ä¸­ã€‚ æ—èƒ¡ç‹ç»é¦¬ã€‚ æ­¸ï¼Œä½¿æ¨“ç·©ä¹‹ç§¦ï¼Œä»‡æ¶²ä¹‹éŸ“ï¼Œç‹è³ä¹‹æ¥šï¼Œå¯Œä¸ä¹‹é­ï¼Œè¶™çˆµä¹‹é½Šã€‚ ä»£ç›¸è¶™å›ºä¸»èƒ¡ï¼Œè‡´å…¶å…µã€‚
In the twentieth year, the king conquered Zhongshan territory, reaching Ningjia; To the west he conquered barbarian lands, reaching Yuzhong. The king of Linhu offered horses. Upon returning, he sent Lou Huan to Qin, Qiu Ye to Han, Wang Ben to Chu, Fu Ding to Wei, Zhao Jue to Qi. The chancellor of Dai, Zhao Gu, controlled the barbarians and brought their troops.

äºŒåä¸€å¹´ï¼Œæ”»ä¸­å±±ã€‚ è¶™è¢‘ç‚ºå³è»ï¼Œè¨±éˆç‚ºå·¦è»ï¼Œå…¬å­ç« ç‚ºä¸­è»ï¼Œç‹å¹¶å°‡ä¹‹ã€‚ ç‰›ç¿¦å°‡è»Šé¨ï¼Œè¶™å¸Œå¹¶å°‡èƒ¡ã€ä»£ã€‚ è¶™èˆ‡ä¹‹é™˜ï¼Œåˆè»æ›²é™½ï¼Œæ”»å–ä¸¹ä¸˜ã€è¯é™½ã€é´Ÿä¹‹å¡ã€‚ ç‹è»å–é„—ã€çŸ³é‚‘ã€å°é¾ã€æ±å£ã€‚ ä¸­å±±ç»å››é‚‘å’Œï¼Œç‹è¨±ä¹‹ï¼Œç½·å…µã€‚ äºŒåä¸‰å¹´ï¼Œæ”»ä¸­å±±ã€‚ äºŒåäº”å¹´ï¼Œæƒ åå’ã€‚ ä½¿å‘¨è¢‘èƒ¡æœå‚…ç‹å­ä½•ã€‚ äºŒåå…­å¹´ï¼Œå¾©æ”»ä¸­å±±ï¼Œæ”˜åœ°åŒ—è‡³ç‡•ã€ä»£ï¼Œè¥¿è‡³é›²ä¸­ã€ä¹åŸã€‚
In the twenty-first year, he attacked Zhongshan. Zhao Fen was the right army, Xu Hun the left army, Prince Zhang the center army, Wang Bing commanded them. Niu Jian commanded the chariots and cavalry, Zhao Xi commanded the barbarian and Dai troops. Zhao rendezvoused at Zhi Gorge, assembled the army at Quyang, and attacked and captured Danqiu, Huayang, and Chi Pass. The king's army captured Xiang, Shiyi, Fenglong, and Dongyuan. Zhongshan offered four cities to sue for peace, the king accepted, and disbanded the troops. In the twenty-third year, he attacked Zhongshan. In the twenty-fifth year, Empress Hui died. He had Zhou Fen dress in barbarian clothing to tutor Prince He. In the twenty-sixth year, he again attacked Zhongshan, expanding territory north to Yan and Dai, west to Yunzhong and Jiuyuan.

äºŒåä¸ƒå¹´äº”æœˆæˆŠç”³ï¼Œå¤§æœæ–¼æ±å®®ï¼Œå‚³åœ‹ï¼Œç«‹ç‹å­ä½•ä»¥ç‚ºç‹ã€‚ ç‹å»Ÿè¦‹ç¦®ç•¢ï¼Œå‡ºè‡¨æœã€‚ å¤§å¤«æ‚‰ç‚ºè‡£ï¼Œè‚¥ç¾©ç‚ºç›¸åœ‹ï¼Œå¹¶å‚…ç‹ã€‚ æ˜¯ç‚ºæƒ æ–‡ç‹ã€‚ æƒ æ–‡ç‹ï¼Œæƒ åå³å¨ƒå­ä¹Ÿã€‚ æ­¦éˆç‹è‡ªè™Ÿç‚ºä¸»çˆ¶ã€‚
In the twenty-seventh year, fifth month, wushen day, he held a great court at the Eastern Palace, transmitted the state, and established Prince He as king. After the king performed the ancestral temple rites, he emerged to hold court. All the grandees became ministers, Fei Yi became chancellor and also tutored the king. This was King Huiwen. King Huiwen was the son of Empress Hui, a Wu woman. King Wuling styled himself as Lord Father.

ä¸»çˆ¶æ¬²ä»¤å­ä¸»æ²»åœ‹ï¼Œè€Œèº«èƒ¡æœå°‡å£«å¤§å¤«è¥¿åŒ—ç•¥èƒ¡åœ°ï¼Œè€Œæ¬²å¾é›²ä¸­ã€ä¹åŸç›´å—è¥²ç§¦ï¼Œæ–¼æ˜¯è©è‡ªç‚ºä½¿è€…å…¥ç§¦ã€‚ ç§¦æ˜­ç‹ä¸çŸ¥ï¼Œå·²è€Œæ€ªå…¶ç‹€ç”šå‰ï¼Œéäººè‡£ä¹‹åº¦ï¼Œä½¿äººé€ä¹‹ï¼Œè€Œä¸»çˆ¶é¦³å·²è„«é—œçŸ£ã€‚ å¯©å•ä¹‹ï¼Œä¹ƒä¸»çˆ¶ä¹Ÿã€‚ ç§¦äººå¤§é©šã€‚ ä¸»çˆ¶æ‰€ä»¥å…¥ç§¦è€…ï¼Œæ¬²è‡ªç•¥åœ°å½¢ï¼Œå› è§€ç§¦ç‹ä¹‹ç‚ºäººä¹Ÿã€‚
Lord Father wished to have his son govern the state while he himself, dressed in barbarian clothing, led the grandees northwest to conquer barbarian lands, and planned to go south directly from Yunzhong and Jiuyuan to attack Qin, thus he disguised himself as an envoy and entered Qin. King Zhao of Qin did not recognize him, but soon found his demeanor exceedingly noble, not that of a subject, and sent people to pursue him, but Lord Father had already galloped away and escaped the pass. When they carefully inquired, it was Lord Father. The people of Qin were greatly astonished. The reason Lord Father entered Qin was to personally survey the terrain and observe the character of the King of Qin.

æƒ æ–‡ç‹äºŒå¹´ï¼Œä¸»çˆ¶è¡Œæ–°åœ°ï¼Œé‚å‡ºä»£ï¼Œè¥¿é‡æ¨“ç…©ç‹æ–¼è¥¿æ²³è€Œè‡´å…¶å…µã€‚
In the second year of King Huiwen, Lord Father toured the new territories, then left Dai, met the king of Loufan west at the Xi River and obtained his troops.

ä¸‰å¹´ï¼Œæ»…ä¸­å±±ï¼Œé·å…¶ç‹æ–¼è†šæ–½ã€‚ èµ·éˆå£½ï¼ŒåŒ—åœ°æ–¹å¾ï¼Œä»£é“å¤§é€šã€‚ é‚„æ­¸ï¼Œè¡Œè³ï¼Œå¤§èµ¦ï¼Œç½®é…’é…ºäº”æ—¥ï¼Œå°é•·å­ç« ç‚ºä»£å®‰é™½å›ã€‚ ç« ç´ ä¾ˆï¼Œå¿ƒä¸æœå…¶å¼Ÿæ‰€ç«‹ã€‚ ä¸»çˆ¶åˆä½¿ç”°ä¸ç¦®ç›¸ç« ä¹Ÿã€‚
In the third year, he destroyed Zhongshan and relocated its king to Fushi. He built Lingshou, the northern territories submitted, the Dai road was greatly opened. Upon returning, he distributed rewards, granted a great amnesty, held drinking feasts for five days, and enfeoffed his eldest son Zhang as Lord of Dai Anyang. Zhang was habitually extravagant, his heart not accepting that his younger brother was established as king. Lord Father also sent Tian Buli to be chancellor for Zhang.

æå…Œè¬‚è‚¥ç¾©æ›°ï¼šã€Œå…¬å­ç« å½Šå£¯è€Œå¿—é©•ï¼Œé»¨çœ¾è€Œæ¬²å¤§ï¼Œæ®†æœ‰ç§ä¹ï¼Ÿ ç”°ä¸ç¦®ä¹‹ç‚ºäººä¹Ÿï¼Œå¿æ®ºè€Œé©•ã€‚ äºŒäººç›¸å¾—ï¼Œå¿…æœ‰è¬€é™°è³Šèµ·ï¼Œä¸€å‡ºèº«å¾¼å¹¸ã€‚ å¤«å°äººæœ‰æ¬²ï¼Œè¼•æ…®æ·ºè¬€ï¼Œå¾’è¦‹å…¶åˆ©è€Œä¸é¡§å…¶å®³ï¼ŒåŒé¡ç›¸æ¨ï¼Œä¿±å…¥ç¦é–€ã€‚ ä»¥å¾è§€ä¹‹ï¼Œå¿…ä¸ä¹…çŸ£ã€‚ å­ä»»é‡è€Œå‹¢å¤§ï¼Œäº‚ä¹‹æ‰€å§‹ï¼Œç¦ä¹‹æ‰€é›†ä¹Ÿï¼Œå­å¿…å…ˆæ‚£ã€‚ ä»è€…æ„›è¬ç‰©è€Œæ™ºè€…å‚™ç¦æ–¼æœªå½¢ï¼Œä¸ä»ä¸æ™ºï¼Œä½•ä»¥ç‚ºåœ‹ï¼Ÿ å­å¥šä¸ç¨±ç–¾æ¯‹å‡ºï¼Œå‚³æ”¿æ–¼å…¬å­æˆï¼Ÿ æ¯‹ç‚ºæ€¨åºœï¼Œæ¯‹ç‚ºç¦æ¢¯ã€‚ã€ è‚¥ç¾©æ›°ï¼šã€Œä¸å¯ï¼Œæ˜”è€…ä¸»çˆ¶ä»¥ç‹å±¬ç¾©ä¹Ÿï¼Œæ›°ï¼šã€æ¯‹è®Šè€Œåº¦ï¼Œæ¯‹ç•°è€Œæ…®ï¼Œå …å®ˆä¸€å¿ƒï¼Œä»¥æ­¿è€Œä¸–ã€‚ã€ ç¾©å†æ‹œå—å‘½è€Œç±ä¹‹ã€‚ ä»Šç•ä¸ç¦®ä¹‹é›£è€Œå¿˜å¾ç±ï¼Œè®Šå­°å¤§ç„‰ã€‚ é€²å—åš´å‘½ï¼Œé€€è€Œä¸å…¨ï¼Œè² å­°ç”šç„‰ã€‚ è®Šè² ä¹‹è‡£ï¼Œä¸å®¹æ–¼åˆ‘ã€‚ è«ºæ›°ã€æ­»è€…å¾©ç”Ÿï¼Œç”Ÿè€…ä¸æ„§ã€ã€‚ å¾è¨€å·²åœ¨å‰çŸ£ï¼Œå¾æ¬²å…¨å¾è¨€ï¼Œå®‰å¾—å…¨å¾èº«ï¼ ä¸”å¤«è²è‡£ä¹Ÿé›£è‡³è€Œç¯€è¦‹ï¼Œå¿ è‡£ä¹Ÿç´¯è‡³è€Œè¡Œæ˜ã€‚ å­å‰‡æœ‰è³œè€Œå¿ æˆ‘çŸ£ï¼Œé›–ç„¶ï¼Œå¾æœ‰èªåœ¨å‰è€…ä¹Ÿï¼Œçµ‚ä¸æ•¢å¤±ã€‚ã€ æå…Œæ›°ï¼šã€Œè«¾ï¼Œå­å‹‰ä¹‹çŸ£ï¼ å¾è¦‹å­å·²ä»Šå¹´è€³ã€‚ã€ æ¶•æ³£è€Œå‡ºã€‚ æå…Œæ•¸è¦‹å…¬å­æˆï¼Œä»¥å‚™ç”°ä¸ç¦®ä¹‹äº‹ã€‚
Li Kui said to Fei Yi: 'Prince Zhang is strong and robust but arrogant in ambition, has many partisans and great desires, he likely has private designs?' Tian Buli's character is tolerant of killing and arrogant. The two get along well, there must be dark treacherous plots arising, seeking personal advantage through risky ventures. Indeed, petty men have desires, shallow planning and superficial schemes, only seeing benefits without considering harm, like kinds pushing each other, all entering the gate of calamity. From my observation, it will not be long. You have heavy responsibilities and great influence, you are where disorder begins, where calamity gathers, you will surely suffer first. The benevolent love all things while the wise prepare for disaster before it takes shape, if not benevolent and not wise, how can one govern the state? Why don't you claim illness and not go out, transfer governance to Prince Cheng? Do not become a repository of resentment, do not become a ladder for calamity.' Fei Yi said: 'It cannot be done. Previously Lord Father entrusted the king to me, saying: "Do not change your standards, do not have different thoughts, firmly hold to one heart, until death and through the ages."' Yi bowed twice, accepted the command, and recorded it. Now fearing Buli's difficulties and forgetting my record, what change could be greater? Having advanced to receive solemn commands, but retreating without fulfilling them, what betrayal could be greater? A minister who changes and betrays is not tolerated by punishment. The proverb says: 'The dead are revived, the living have no regrets.' My words are already spoken before, I wish to fulfill my words, how can I preserve my body! Moreover, the steadfast minister shows his integrity when difficulties arrive, the loyal minister clarifies his conduct when troubles accumulate. You have already honored me with your counsel and been loyal to me, although, I have words spoken before, I ultimately dare not lose them.' Li Kui said: 'Very well, do your best!' 'I will see you again this year.' Weeping, he left. Li Kui frequently met with Prince Cheng to prepare for Tian Buli's matters.

Another day Fei Yi said to Xin Qi: 'The prince and Tian Buli are greatly worrisome.' In regard to righteousness, he has a good reputation but evil reality, this kind of person is neither filial nor a proper minister. I have heard that when treacherous ministers are in court, it is the ruin of the state; Slanderous ministers in the center are the ruler's parasites. This person is greedy and desires greatness, internally he gains the master's favor but externally acts tyrannically. Falsifying orders to be disrespectful, monopolizing the command of a single day, it is not difficult to do, but calamity will reach the state. Now I worry about it, at night forgetting sleep, when hungry forgetting food. Thieves and bandits entering and leaving cannot but be guarded against. From now on, if anyone summons the king, they must see my face first. I will personally block them; only if there is no treachery may the king enter.' Xin Qi said: 'Excellent! I am fortunate to hear this!'

In the fourth year, he held court for the ministers, the Lord of Anyang also came to court. Lord Father had the king hold court while he himself observed from the side, examining the ministers and royal family's etiquette. Seeing his eldest son Zhang standing dejectedly, facing north as a minister, bowing to his younger brother, his heart pitied him, thus he wished to divide Zhao and make Zhang king in Dai, but the plan was undecided and abandoned.

Lord Father and the king toured Shaqiu, staying in separate palaces. Prince Zhang immediately with his followers and Tian Buli rebelled, falsely using Lord Father's command to summon the king. Fei Yi entered first and killed them. Gao Xin immediately fought with the king. Prince Cheng and Li Kui arrived from the capital, then raised troops from four cities to enter and resist the difficulty, killed Prince Zhang and Tian Buli, exterminated their partisan traitors and pacified the royal house. Prince Cheng became chancellor, titled Lord of Anping, Li Kui became judicial minister. When Prince Zhang was defeated, he fled to Lord Father. Lord Father opened the door for him, but Cheng and Kui then surrounded Lord Father's palace. When Prince Zhang died, Prince Cheng and Li Kui plotted: 'Because of Zhang we besieged Lord Father, if we now withdraw troops, we will be executed.' Thus they continued to besiege Lord Father. They ordered the palace people 'Whoever comes out last will be executed,' so all the palace people came out. Lord Father wished to leave but could not, and could not get food. He picked up the clay cups and ate them, and after more than three months starved to death in the Shaqiu palace. After Lord Father was confirmed dead, they announced the mourning and informed the feudal lords.

(After Lord Father died, King Huiwen was established) In the fifth year, he exchanged Yan Dan and Yi. In the eighth year, he built the city of Nanxing Tang. Your servant has heard that the virtuous rulers of antiquity did not spread their virtue throughout the realm, nor did their teachings and obedience reach all the people, nor did their sacrifices and seasonal offerings frequently attend to the spirits. In the first year of King Xiaocheng, Qin attacked us, captured three cities. The King of Zhao had newly ascended, the Dowager Queen was in power, Qin urgently attacked them. The Zhao clan sought aid from Qi, Qi said: 'You must send the Lord of Chang'an as hostage, then troops will be sent.' The Dowager Queen refused, the ministers strongly remonstrated. The Dowager Queen clearly told those around her: 'Whoever again speaks of sending the Lord of Chang'an as hostage, this old woman will spit in their face.' The Left Tutor Zhuo Long said he wished to see the Dowager Queen, the Dowager Queen in great anger waited for him. He entered, slowly approached and sat, apologized to himself: 'This old minister has sick feet, has not been able to walk quickly, has not seen you for a long time.' 'I secretly excuse myself, but feared that your majesty's body might be suffering somewhat, thus I wished to have an audience with your majesty.' The Dowager Queen said: 'This old woman relies on a palanquin to get around.' 'Is your appetite perhaps declining?' 'I rely on gruel.' 'This old minister recently had no desire for food, so I forced myself to walk, three or four li per day, gradually improved my appetite, and it harmonizes my body.' The Dowager Queen said: 'This old woman cannot.' The Dowager Queen's angry expression slightly relaxed. The Left Tutor said: 'This old minister's humble son Shuqi is the youngest, unworthy, and since I am declining, I secretly cherish and love him, I wish to obtain a position in the black-robed guards to protect the royal palace, I risk death in making this request.' The Dowager Queen said: 'I respectfully comply. How old is he?' He replied: 'Fifteen years old. Though young, I wish to entrust him while I have not yet filled the ditches and graves.' The Dowager Queen said: 'Do men also cherish their youngest sons?' He replied: 'More than women do.' The Dowager Queen laughed and said: 'Women are exceedingly different.' He replied: 'This old minister privately believes that your majesty's love for the Queen of Yan surpasses that for the Lord of Chang'an.' The Dowager Queen said: 'You are mistaken, it is not as great as for the Lord of Chang'an.' The Left Tutor said: 'When parents love their children, they plan deeply for them. When your majesty sent away the Queen of Yan, you held her feet, wept for her, thinking of her distance, and grieved for her.' Once she had departed, you did not cease thinking of her. During sacrifices you prayed: 'Do not let her return.' Was this not planning for the long term, ensuring that her descendants would succeed each other as kings?' The Dowager Queen said: 'Yes.' The Left Tutor said: 'Now, from three generations ago until now, among the descendants of Zhao rulers who became marquises, are any of their successors still extant?' She said: 'None.' She said: 'Not only Zhao, are there any among the other feudal lords who still exist?' She said: 'This old woman has not heard of any.' He said: 'This is because the near ones' calamity reaches their own persons, the distant ones' reaches their descendants. Could it be that the sons of rulers who become marquises are not good?' 'Their position is honored but without merit, their emoluments thick but without labor, yet they hold many precious vessels.' 'Now your majesty honors the Lord of Chang'an's position, enfeoffs him with fertile lands, gives him many precious vessels, but does not cause him to have merit for the state now. Once the mountain tomb collapses, how will the Lord of Chang'an establish himself in Zhao?' 'This old minister believes your majesty's planning for the Lord of Chang'an is short-sighted, thus I believe your love for him does not surpass that for the Queen of Yan.' The Dowager Queen said: 'Very well, I leave it to you to arrange as you see fit.' Thus they prepared a hundred chariots for the Lord of Chang'an and sent him as hostage to Qi; Qi's troops then marched out.

In the fourth year, the king dreamed he wore one-sided fur clothing, rode a flying dragon up to heaven, but did not reach it and fell, seeing accumulations of gold and jade like mountains. 'Riding a flying dragon up to heaven but not reaching it and falling means having form but no substance.' 'Seeing accumulations of gold and jade like mountains means worry.'

å¾Œä¸‰æ—¥ï¼ŒéŸ“æ°ä¸Šé»¨å®ˆé¦®äº­ä½¿è€…è‡³ï¼Œæ›°ï¼šã€ŒéŸ“ä¸èƒ½å®ˆä¸Šé»¨ï¼Œå…¥ä¹‹æ–¼ç§¦ã€‚ å…¶åæ°‘çš†å®‰ç‚ºè¶™ï¼Œä¸æ¬²ç‚ºç§¦ã€‚ æœ‰åŸå¸‚é‚‘åä¸ƒï¼Œé¡˜å†æ‹œå…¥ä¹‹è¶™ï¼Œè²¡ç‹æ‰€ä»¥è³œåæ°‘ã€‚ã€ ç‹å¤§å–œï¼Œå¬å¹³é™½å›è±¹å‘Šä¹‹æ›°ï¼šã€Œé¦®äº­å…¥åŸå¸‚é‚‘åä¸ƒï¼Œå—ä¹‹ä½•å¦‚ï¼Ÿã€ å°æ›°ï¼šã€Œè–äººç”šç¦ç„¡æ•…ä¹‹åˆ©ã€‚ã€ ç‹æ›°ï¼šã€Œäººæ‡·å¾å¾·ï¼Œä½•è¬‚ç„¡æ•…ä¹ï¼Ÿã€ å°æ›°ï¼šã€Œå¤«ç§¦è ¶é£ŸéŸ“æ°åœ°ï¼Œä¸­çµ•ä¸ä»¤ç›¸é€šï¼Œå›ºè‡ªä»¥ç‚ºåè€Œå—ä¸Šé»¨ä¹‹åœ°ä¹Ÿã€‚ éŸ“æ°æ‰€ä»¥ä¸å…¥æ–¼ç§¦è€…ï¼Œæ¬²å«å…¶ç¦æ–¼è¶™ä¹Ÿã€‚ ç§¦æœå…¶å‹è€Œè¶™å—å…¶åˆ©ï¼Œé›–å½Šå¤§ä¸èƒ½å¾—ä¹‹æ–¼å°å¼±ï¼Œå°å¼±é¡§èƒ½å¾—ä¹‹æ–¼å½Šå¤§ä¹ï¼Ÿ è±ˆå¯è¬‚éç„¡æ•…ä¹‹åˆ©å“‰ï¼ ä¸”å¤«ç§¦ä»¥ç‰›ç”°ä¹‹æ°´é€šç³§è ¶é£Ÿï¼Œä¸Šä¹˜å€æˆ°è€…ï¼Œè£‚ä¸Šåœ‹ä¹‹åœ°ï¼Œå…¶æ”¿è¡Œï¼Œä¸å¯èˆ‡ç‚ºé›£ï¼Œå¿…å‹¿å—ä¹Ÿã€‚ã€ ç‹æ›°ï¼šã€Œä»Šç™¼ç™¾è¬ä¹‹è»è€Œæ”»ï¼Œè¸°å¹´æ­·æ­²æœªå¾—ä¸€åŸä¹Ÿã€‚ ä»Šä»¥åŸå¸‚é‚‘åä¸ƒå¹£å¾åœ‹ï¼Œæ­¤å¤§åˆ©ä¹Ÿã€‚ã€
Three days later, the envoy of Han's Shangdang governor Feng Ting arrived, saying: 'Han cannot defend Shangdang and will cede it to Qin.' 'Its officials and people would all prefer to be Zhao subjects, they do not wish to be Qin subjects.' 'There are seventeen cities and towns; we wish to bow twice and offer them to Zhao, for your majesty to reward the officials and people as you see fit.' The king was greatly pleased, summoned the Lord of Pingyang Zhao Bao and told him: 'Feng Ting is offering seventeen cities and townsâ€”what do you think of accepting?' He replied: 'The sages greatly fear unearned benefits.' The king said: 'People cherish my virtueâ€”what do you mean by unearned?' He replied: 'Qin has been nibbling away at Han's territory, cutting it off in the middle so it cannot connect, and certainly expects to sit and receive Shangdang's lands.' 'The reason Han does not cede to Qin is that they wish to shift their calamity to Zhao.' 'Qin bears the effort while Zhao receives the benefitâ€”though the strong cannot take from the weak, how can the weak take from the strong?' 'How can this not be called unearned benefit!' 'Moreover, Qin uses the Nitian waterway to transport grain while nibbling away, their elite troops fight with double strength, splitting the lands of superior statesâ€”their governance succeeds, one cannot contend with them. You must not accept.' The king said: 'Now if we dispatch a million-man army to attack, it would take years and still not capture a single city.' 'Now with seventeen cities and towns enriching our state, this is great benefit.'

Officials and people will all advance three ranks in nobility. Officials and people who can live in harmony will all be granted six pieces of gold.' Feng Ting wept and would not see the envoy, saying: 'I will not commit three unrighteous acts: Serving my lord to guard territory, I could not die defending itâ€”this is the first unrighteousness;' 'Ceding it to Qin, I did not obey my lord's commandâ€”this is the second unrighteousness;' 'Selling my lord's territory and profiting from itâ€”this is the third unrighteousness.' In the fifteenth year, with Yuwen he enfeoffed Chancellor Lian Po as Lord of Xinping. He replied: 'It would not.' The King of Yan was greatly angered. All the ministers considered it acceptable. In the sixth year, great famine, the people spread rumors saying: 'Zhao makes the call, Qin laughs.' 'To test if it's not believed, look for the earth growing hair.'

In the seventh year, Qin attacked Zhao, Zhao's great general Li Mu and general Sima Shang commanded, attacked them. Li Mu was executed, Sima Shang dismissed, Zhao Cong and Qi general Yan Ju replaced them. Zhao Cong's army was broken, Yan Ju fled. King Qian surrendered.

In the eighth year tenth month, Handan fell to Qin.

The Grand Scribe says. I heard Feng Wangsun say: 'King Qian of Zhao, his mother was a singing girl, favored by King Daoxiang.' King Daoxiang deposed the legitimate son Jia and established Qian. Qian was habitually without conduct, believed slanderers, thus executed his good general Li Mu, employed Guo Kai.' Was this not a grave error! After Qin had captured Qian, Zhao's exiled grandees together established Jia as king. He reigned in Dai for six years. Qin advanced troops, defeated Jia, and thus extinguished Zhao to make it a commandery.
